intro: Antirrhinum inaculatum, commonly known as the slender snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Antirrhinum inaculatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and ease of care.
